TopicTitle: Altitude boundary charts for science and warp speeds.

Articles.Content:
Updated: Visual polishing, one chart for science boundaries and another for warp boundaries.

![Z9lmaKZ.png](http://i.imgur.com/Z9lmaKZ.png)

![CW4ifU8.png](http://i.imgur.com/CW4ifU8.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-02T12:26:10Z" title="06/02/2015 12:26  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 2, 2015</time> by LittleBlueGaming**

[http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80220-Celestial-Body-Science-Multiplier-Editor](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80220-Celestial-Body-Science-Multiplier-Editor)

Will use your data to verify if the standard config of this still correct in 1.0.2 - so basically posting for future reference but nice chart, makes me think about a second monitor again, all this usful information in so many different files ... and I really do not want to waste paper on everything to only clutter my desk more. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
That looks really cool. To be able to find it right when I need it, I personally think that picture would be a great addition to the wiki page itself.

> 
> [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80220-Celestial-Body-Science-Multiplier-Editor](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/80220-Celestial-Body-Science-Multiplier-Editor)
> Will use your data to verify if the standard config of this still correct in 1.0.2 - so basically posting for future reference but nice chart, makes me think about a second monitor again, all this usful information in so many different files ... and I really do not want to waste paper on everything to only clutter my desk more. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> That looks really cool. To be able to find it right when I need it, I personally think that picture would be a great addition to the wiki page itself.

Thanks. I know it could really benefit from some proper design though, I'm just not very good at that kind of thing.
This is such a great idea. It would be awesome if you would do the same thing for non-physics warp levels.
Very cool. Visual aids are the best.

> 
> This is such a great idea. It would be awesome if you would do the same thing for non-physics warp levels.

You know what? That's a good idea ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Added a chart for warp boundaries.

Thanks a bunch!
